00033 /* State flags */
00034 
00035 #define XNSUSP    0x00000001 
00036 #define XNPEND    0x00000002 
00037 #define XNDELAY   0x00000004 
00038 #define XNREADY   0x00000008 
00039 #define XNDORMANT 0x00000010 
00040 #define XNZOMBIE  0x00000020 
00041 #define XNSTARTED 0x00000080 
00042 #define XNMAPPED  0x00000100 
00043 #define XNRELAX   0x00000200 
00044 #define XNMIGRATE 0x00000400 
00045 #define XNHELD    0x00000800 
00047 #define XNBOOST   0x00001000 
00048 #define XNDEBUG   0x00002000 
00049 #define XNLOCK    0x00004000 
00050 #define XNRRB     0x00008000 
00051 #define XNASDI    0x00010000 
00052 #define XNDEFCAN  0x00020000 
00053 #define XNTRAPSW  0x00040000 
00054 #define XNFPU     0x00080000 
00055 #define XNSHADOW  0x00100000 
00056 #define XNROOT    0x00200000 
00057 #define XNOTHER   0x00400000  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_state_flags */
00060 
00061 /*
00062   Must follow the declaration order of the above bits. Status symbols
00063   are defined as follows:
00064   'S' -> Forcibly suspended.
00065   'w'/'W' -> Waiting for a resource, with or without timeout.
00066   'D' -> Delayed (without any other wait condition).
00067   'R' -> Runnable.
00068   'U' -> Unstarted or dormant.
00069   'X' -> Relaxed shadow.
00070   'H' -> Held in emergency.
00071   'b' -> Priority boost undergoing.
00072   'T' -> Ptraced and stopped.
00073   'l' -> Locks scheduler.
00074   'r' -> Undergoes round-robin.
00075   't' -> Mode switches trapped.
00076   'f' -> FPU enabled (for kernel threads).
00077 */
00078 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_LABELS  "SWDRU....X.HbTlr...tf..."
00079 
00080 #define XNTHREAD_BLOCK_BITS   (XNSUSP|XNPEND|XNDELAY|XNDORMANT|XNRELAX|XNMIGRATE|XNHELD)
00081 #define XNTHREAD_MODE_BITS    (XNLOCK|XNRRB|XNASDI|XNTRAPSW)
00082 
00083 /* These state flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00084 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE0  0x10000000
00085 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE1  0x20000000
00086 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE2  0x40000000
00087 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE3  0x80000000
00088 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARES  0xf0000000
00089 
00096 /* Information flags */
00097 
00098 #define XNTIMEO   0x00000001 
00099 #define XNRMID    0x00000002 
00100 #define XNBREAK   0x00000004 
00101 #define XNKICKED  0x00000008 
00102 #define XNWAKEN   0x00000010 
00103 #define XNROBBED  0x00000020 
00104 #define XNAFFSET  0x00000040 
00105 #define XNPRIOSET 0x00000080 
00106 #define XNABORT   0x00000100 
00107 #define XNCANPND  0x00000200 
00108 #define XNSWREP   0x00000400 
00110 /* These information flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00111 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE0  0x10000000
00112 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE1  0x20000000
00113 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE2  0x40000000
00114 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE3  0x80000000
00115 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARES  0xf0000000
00116  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_info_flags */

00193 typedef struct xnthread {
00194 
00195         xnarchtcb_t tcb;                /* Architecture-dependent block -- Must be first */
00196 
00197         xnflags_t state;                /* Thread state flags */
00198 
00199         xnflags_t info;                 /* Thread information flags */
00200 
00201         struct xnsched *sched;          /* Thread scheduler */
00202 
00203         struct xnsched_class *sched_class; /* Current scheduling class */
00204 
00205         struct xnsched_class *base_class; /* Base scheduling class */
00206 
00207 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_SCHED_TP
00208         struct xnsched_tpslot *tps;     /* Current partition slot for TP scheduling */
00209         struct xnholder tp_link;        /* Link in per-sched TP thread queue */
00210 #endif
00211 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_SCHED_SPORADIC
00212         struct xnsched_sporadic_data *pss; /* Sporadic scheduling data. */
00213 #endif
00214 
00215         unsigned idtag;                 /* Unique ID tag */
00216 
00217         xnarch_cpumask_t affinity;      /* Processor affinity. */
00218 
00219         int bprio;                      /* Base priority (before PIP boost) */
00220 
00221         int cprio;                      /* Current priority */
00222 
00223         u_long schedlck;                
00225         xnpholder_t rlink;              /* Thread holder in ready queue */
00226 
00227         xnpholder_t plink;              /* Thread holder in synchronization queue(s) */
00228 
00229         xnholder_t glink;               /* Thread holder in global queue */
00230 
00231 #define link2thread(ln, fld)    container_of(ln, struct xnthread, fld)
00232 
00233         xnpqueue_t claimq;              /* Owned resources claimed by others (PIP) */
00234 
00235         struct xnsynch *wchan;          /* Resource the thread pends on */
00236 
00237         struct xnsynch *wwake;          /* Wait channel the thread was resumed from */
00238 
00239         int hrescnt;                    /* Held resources count */
00240 
00241         xntimer_t rtimer;               /* Resource timer */
00242 
00243         xntimer_t ptimer;               /* Periodic timer */
00244 
00245         xntimer_t rrbtimer;             /* Round-robin timer */
00246 
00247         xnsigmask_t signals;            /* Pending core signals */
00248 
00249         xnticks_t rrperiod;             /* Allotted round-robin period (ns) */
00250 
00251         struct xnthread_wait_context *wcontext; /* Active wait context. */
00252 
00253         struct {
00254                 xnstat_counter_t ssw;   /* Primary -> secondary mode switch count */
00255                 xnstat_counter_t csw;   /* Context switches (includes secondary -> primary switches) */
00256                 xnstat_counter_t xsc;   /* Xenomai syscalls */
00257                 xnstat_counter_t pf;    /* Number of page faults */
00258                 xnstat_exectime_t account; /* Execution time accounting entity */
00259                 xnstat_exectime_t lastperiod; /* Interval marker for execution time reports */
00260         } stat;
00261 
00262         struct xnselector *selector;    /* For select. */
00263 
00264         xnasr_t asr;                    /* Asynchronous service routine */
00265 
00266         xnflags_t asrmode;              /* Thread's mode for ASR */
00267 
00268         int asrimask;                   /* Thread's interrupt mask for ASR */
00269 
00270         unsigned asrlevel;              /* ASR execution level (ASRs are reentrant) */
00271 
00272         int imask;                      /* Initial interrupt mask */
00273 
00274         int imode;                      /* Initial mode */
00275 
00276         struct xnsched_class *init_class; /* Initial scheduling class */
00277 
00278         union xnsched_policy_param init_schedparam; /* Initial scheduling parameters */
00279 
00280         struct {
00281                 xnhandle_t handle;      /* Handle in registry */
00282                 const char *waitkey;    /* Pended key */
00283         } registry;
00284 
00285         struct xnthread_operations *ops; /* Thread class operations. */
00286 
00287         char name[XNOBJECT_NAME_LEN]; /* Symbolic name of thread */
00288 
00289         void (*entry)(void *cookie); /* Thread entry routine */
00290 
00291         void *cookie;           /* Cookie to pass to the entry routine */
00292 
00293         struct pt_regs *regs;           /* Current register frame */
00294         struct xnthread_user_window *u_window;  /* Data visible from userland. */
00295 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_DEBUG
00296         const char *exe_path;   /* Executable path */
00297         u32 proghash;           /* Hash value for exe_path */
00298 #endif
00299 
00300 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_LEGACY_IPIPE
00301         struct ipipe_threadinfo ipipe_data;
00302 #endif
00303 } xnthread_t;

00309 typedef struct xnhook {
00310         xnholder_t link;
00311 #define link2hook(ln)           container_of(ln, xnhook_t, link)
00312         void (*routine)(struct xnthread *thread);
00313 } xnhook_t;

00315 #define xnthread_name(thread)               ((thread)->name)
00316 #define xnthread_clear_name(thread)        do { *(thread)->name = 0; } while(0)
00317 #define xnthread_sched(thread)             ((thread)->sched)
00318 #define xnthread_start_time(thread)        ((thread)->stime)
00319 #define xnthread_state_flags(thread)       ((thread)->state)
00320 #define xnthread_test_state(thread,flags)  testbits((thread)->state,flags)
00321 #define xnthread_set_state(thread,flags)   __setbits((thread)->state,flags)
00322 #define xnthread_clear_state(thread,flags) __clrbits((thread)->state,flags)
00323 #define xnthread_test_info(thread,flags)   testbits((thread)->info,flags)
00324 #define xnthread_set_info(thread,flags)    __setbits((thread)->info,flags)
00325 #define xnthread_clear_info(thread,flags)  __clrbits((thread)->info,flags)
00326 #define xnthread_lock_count(thread)        ((thread)->schedlck)
00327 #define xnthread_init_schedparam(thread)   ((thread)->init_schedparam)
00328 #define xnthread_base_priority(thread)     ((thread)->bprio)
00329 #define xnthread_current_priority(thread)  ((thread)->cprio)
00330 #define xnthread_init_class(thread)        ((thread)->init_class)
00331 #define xnthread_base_class(thread)        ((thread)->base_class)
00332 #define xnthread_sched_class(thread)       ((thread)->sched_class)
00333 #define xnthread_time_slice(thread)        ((thread)->rrperiod)
00334 #define xnthread_archtcb(thread)           (&((thread)->tcb))
00335 #define xnthread_asr_level(thread)         ((thread)->asrlevel)
00336 #define xnthread_pending_signals(thread)  ((thread)->signals)
00337 #define xnthread_timeout(thread)           xntimer_get_timeout(&(thread)->rtimer)
00338 #define xnthread_stack_size(thread)        xnarch_stack_size(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00339 #define xnthread_stack_base(thread)        xnarch_stack_base(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00340 #define xnthread_stack_end(thread)         xnarch_stack_end(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00341 #define xnthread_handle(thread)            ((thread)->registry.handle)
00342 #define xnthread_signaled_p(thread)        ((thread)->signals != 0)
00343 #define xnthread_user_task(thread)         xnarch_user_task(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00344 #define xnthread_user_pid(thread) \
00345     (xnthread_test_state((thread),XNROOT) || !xnthread_user_task(thread) ? \
00346     0 : xnarch_user_pid(xnthread_archtcb(thread)))
00347 #define xnthread_affinity(thread)          ((thread)->affinity)
00348 #define xnthread_affine_p(thread, cpu)     xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, (thread)->affinity)
00349 #define xnthread_get_exectime(thread)      xnstat_exectime_get_total(&(thread)->stat.account)
00350 #define xnthread_get_lastswitch(thread)    xnstat_exectime_get_last_switch((thread)->sched)
00351 #define xnthread_inc_rescnt(thread)        ({ (thread)->hrescnt++; })
00352 #define xnthread_dec_rescnt(thread)        ({ --(thread)->hrescnt; })
00353 #define xnthread_get_rescnt(thread)        ((thread)->hrescnt)

00355 static inline unsigned xnthread_get_magic(struct xnthread *t)
00356 {
00357         return t->ops ? t->ops->get_magic() : 0;
00358 }
00359 
00360 static inline
00361 struct xnthread_wait_context *xnthread_get_wait_context(struct xnthread *thread)
00362 {
00363         return thread->wcontext;
00364 }
00365 
00366 static inline
00367 int xnthread_register(struct xnthread *thread, const char *name)
00368 {
00369         return xnregistry_enter(name, thread, &xnthread_handle(thread), NULL);
00370 }
00371 
00372 static inline
00373 struct xnthread *xnthread_lookup(xnhandle_t threadh)
00374 {
00375         struct xnthread *thread = (struct xnthread *)xnregistry_lookup(threadh);
00376         return (thread && xnthread_handle(thread) == threadh) ? thread : NULL;
00377 }
00378 
00379 static inline void xnthread_sync_window(struct xnthread *thread)
00380 {
00381         thread->u_window->state = thread->state;
00382 }
00383 
00384 static inline
00385 void xnthread_clear_sync_window(struct xnthread *thread, int bits)
00386 {
00387         thread->u_window->state = thread->state & ~bits;
00388 }
00389 
00390 static inline
00391 void xnthread_set_sync_window(struct xnthread *thread, int bits)
00392 {
00393         thread->u_window->state = thread->state | bits;
00394 }
00395 
00396 /*
00397  * XXX: Mutual dependency issue with synch.h, we have to define
00398  * xnsynch_release() here.
00399  */
00400 static inline struct xnthread *
00401 xnsynch_release(struct xnsynch *synch, struct xnthread *thread)
00402 {
00403         xnarch_atomic_t *lockp;
00404         xnhandle_t threadh;
00405 
00406         XENO_BUGON(NUCLEUS, !testbits(synch->status, XNSYNCH_OWNER));
00407 
00408         trace_mark(xn_nucleus, synch_release, "synch %p", synch);
00409 
00410         if (unlikely(xnthread_test_state(thread, XNOTHER)))
00411                 __xnsynch_fixup_rescnt(thread);
00412 
00413         lockp = xnsynch_fastlock(synch);
00414         threadh = xnthread_handle(thread);
00415         if (likely(xnsynch_fast_release(lockp, threadh)))
00416                 return NULL;
00417 
00418         return __xnsynch_transfer_ownership(synch, thread);
00419 }
